intro: Sisymbrium briquetii, commonly known as the Mediterranean babylon wheat, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Sisymbrium briquetii is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
